definition[0]: used to say that someone cannot have, take, or touch something
example[0]: Hey! Hands off that CD! Itâ€™s mine!
example[1]: Tell your little brother to keep his hands off my car.
definition[1]: a hands-off way of organizing something involves letting people do what they want and make their own decisions, without telling them what to do
example[3]: The government has a hands-off approach to the industry.
definition[2]: not telling the people you are in charge of exactly what to do, but letting them make their own decisions
example[4]: His hands-off approach to management was seen by some as laziness.
